intro: Centotheca uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower centotheca, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow leaves. The plant produces a single, small, spike-like inflorescence that bears tiny, inconspicuous flowers. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat requirements, it is considered endangered and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical study is important for understanding biodiversity in its native ecosystems.
